title: L3Harris demonstrated a digital phased array antenna system
summary: During the demonstration in Fairbanks, Alaska, the antenna system prototype handled an average of more than 300 satellite contacts per day, including up to eight simultaneous contacts.

title: Collins performs tests of new space station spacesuit
summary: Collins Aerospace, one of the companies with a NASA award to develop a new generation of spacesuits, has completed a series of tests of that design in a microgravity environment on an aircraft.

title: National Guard, Air Force, working to resolve impasse over space units
summary: Space operations units in the Air National Guard face uncertain future as political fight continues on whether to fund a Space National Guard

title: Resilient Space Order of Battle: Flexible, Adaptable & Affordable
summary: Anyone who’s played the board game “Battleship” is familiar with the notion of operational resilience. Gameplay is simple: Each player has a fleet of five plastic ships that they place […]

title: Satellite operator OQ Technology joins direct-to-smartphone bandwagon
summary: Europe has given Luxembourg’s OQ Technology a contract to study ways to connect unmodified smartphones from its low Earth orbit constellation, which currently provides narrowband connectivity for remote Internet of Things (IoT) devices.

title: Hawaiian Airlines debuts free inflight Wi-Fi from SpaceX’s Starlink
summary: Hawaiian Airlines is rolling out complimentary Wi-Fi via SpaceX’s Starlink on board commercial flights this week, the companies told CNBC, the first major U.S. airline to offer the satellite-based service.

title: Maxar Intelligence names new chief technology officer
summary: Veteran tech executive Arvind Srinivasan joins Maxar as chief technology officer.

title: Dream Chaser undergoes NASA testing ahead of first flight
summary: Sierra Space’s Dream Chaser vehicle is one step closer to launching no earlier than the first half of 2024 following testing at NASA’s Neil Armstrong Test Facility, formerly known as Plum Brook Station, in Ohio.

title: Investing in Space: How bankers read a potential sale of rocket builder ULA
summary: You may have heard United Launch Alliance is for sale.

title: NASA’s Newest Ocean Mission Takes Flight
summary: After nearly nine years of planning, preparation, and even once being slated for cancellation entirely, NASA’s Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem (PACE) Earth-observation mission lifted off from Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station on February 8, at 1:33:36 AM. This nearly billion dollar mission represents almost a decade of work, with the goal of revolutionizing our understanding of Earth’s dynamic oceans.
